channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Israel and Iran's fragile ceasefire. And, what to know about NYC's mayoral race
item.description: President Trump announced that a ceasefire has been established between Israel and Iran, but strikes continued as it was set to take place. And, what to know about NYC's mayoral race.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump announced that a ceasefire has been established between Israel and Iran, but strikes continued as it was set to take place. And, what to know about NYC's mayoral race.

(Image credit: Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: She hoped key research could help save her eyesight. Then the Trump funding cuts came
item.description: Jessica Chaikof says research into gene therapies could someday save her eyesight. But she worries cuts to federal research funding could mean that therapy won't be ready in time.
item.content:encoded:
Jessica Chaikof says research into gene therapies could someday save her eyesight. But she worries cuts to federal research funding could mean that therapy won't be ready in time.

(Image credit: Craig LeMoult)
item.dc:creator: Craig LeMoult

item.title: The Trump administration is making an unprecedented reach for data held by states
item.description: States hold troves of sensitive personal data that were previously never shared with the federal government or across federal agencies. The Trump administration is trying to change that.
item.content:encoded:
States hold troves of sensitive personal data that were previously never shared with the federal government or across federal agencies. The Trump administration is trying to change that.

(Image credit: Ronaldo Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: Jude Joffe-Block

item.title: RFK Jr. and Dr. Oz say health insurers will cut red tape on 'prior authorizations'
item.description: In recent years, health insurers ramped up the practice of requiring doctors to get their approval before tests and procedures. On Monday, health leaders announced voluntary reforms from insurers.
item.content:encoded:
In recent years, health insurers ramped up the practice of requiring doctors to get their approval before tests and procedures. On Monday, health leaders announced voluntary reforms from insurers.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Sen. Murkowski on why she's having more talks than ever on the state of democracy
item.description: Sen. Lisa Murkowski, R-Alaska, sat down with All Things Considered host Juana Summers to discuss her memoir, her thoughts on Trump's sweeping domestic policy bill and the future of democracy.
item.content:encoded:
Sen. Lisa Murkowski, R-Alaska, sat down with All Things Considered host Juana Summers to discuss her memoir, her thoughts on Trump's sweeping domestic policy bill and the future of democracy.

(Image credit: Nickolai Hammar)
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: TikTok bans #SkinnyTok. But content promoting unhealthy eating persists
item.description: The social media platform TikTok recently banned a hashtag called #SkinnyTok after European regulators warned it was promoting extreme weight loss. But eliminating this kind of content is not easy.
item.content:encoded:
The social media platform TikTok recently banned a hashtag called #SkinnyTok after European regulators warned it was promoting extreme weight loss. But eliminating this kind of content is not easy.

(Image credit: elenabs)
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Purple Heart Army veteran self-deports after nearly 50 years in the U.S.
item.description: Sae Joon Park left for South Korea on Monday. His removal order was the result of drug possession and bail jumping charges from over 15 years ago — offenses that, he said, stemmed from untreated PTSD.
item.content:encoded: Sae Joon Park left for South Korea on Monday. His removal order was the result of drug possession and bail jumping charges from over 15 years ago — offenses that, he said, stemmed from untreated PTSD.
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Trump is 'not happy' with Israel after saying it and Iran both broke a ceasefire
item.description: President Trump lashed out at Israel and Iran for possible violations of a ceasefire.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump lashed out at Israel and Iran for possible violations of a ceasefire.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Alex Leff

item.title: Early-season heat dome brings highest temperatures in years to parts of Eastern U.S.
item.description: An intense and nearly historic weather pattern is cooking much of America under a dangerous heat dome this week with triple-digit temperatures in places that haven't been so hot in more than a decade.
item.content:encoded:
An intense and nearly historic weather pattern is cooking much of America under a dangerous heat dome this week with triple-digit temperatures in places that haven't been so hot in more than a decade.

(Image credit: Jon Cherry)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Russian attacks on Ukraine kill 14 civilians as Zelenskyy travels to UK
item.description: The attacks came as Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy began a visit to the United Kingdom, where he met privately with King Charles III.
item.content:encoded:
The attacks came as Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy began a visit to the United Kingdom, where he met privately with King Charles III.

(Image credit: Frank Augstein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
